scopes.name: preamble
scopes.explanation: Lines 2-8 contain the contract title, date, parties, and the introductory language that forms the preamble of the CSA. Line 2 gives the document name, lines 3-4 reference the ISDA Master Agreement and its date, lines 5-6 list the parties, and lines 7-8 are the standard preamble language. Line 1 is just the exhibit label, and line 9 begins substantive terms.

scopes.name: Annex
scopes.explanation: The Annex, containing the negotiated terms of the CSA, begins at Paragraph 13 (line 10: 'Paragraph 13. Elections and Variables') and continues through the signature block at line 182. This matches the standard structure for a New York law CSA, where Paragraph 13 is the annex. The preceding lines (0-9) are preamble and incorporation language, and line 183 begins Exhibit A, which is outside the Annex.
